definitions.definition: Physically secure and certain , non-failing, reliable.
examples: This investment is a sure thing.
The bailiff had a sure grip on the prisoner's arm.

definitions.definition: Certain in one's knowledge or belief .
examples: Are you sure to succeed, as polls say? —Well, I am at least certain of making it to the podium this time.
He was sure of being a finalist.
They aren't sure who will attend for sure .
You seemed sure that the car was his.  Yeah. I’m not sure what is the point of spending hours and hours discussing this.

definitions.definition: Certain to act or be a specified way.
examples: Be sure to lock the door when you leave.

main_definition: Physically secure and certain , non-failing, reliable.
secondary_definitions: Certain in one's knowledge or belief .
( followed by a to infinitive ) Certain to act or be a specified way.
( obsolete ) Free from danger; safe; secure.
